alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 26 at 2:33PM AKST until December 27 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below expected. * WHERE...Lower Kobuk Valley, Baldwin Peninsula and Northern Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold temperatures are occuring over Northwest Alaska today. Winds are expected to increase around Kotzebue Sound and cause very cold winds chills to develop.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula
